pageContext.claim: “I'm proud that under my administration, we've delivered $1.5 billion for public charter schools. That’s a record.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump actually proposed cutting charter school funding in his most recent budget, calling for the effective elimination of the federal Charter Schools Program. The federal government has provided about $4 billion for charter schools since 1995, after enthusiastic promotion by Bill Clinton. The funding has been marginally higher under Trump, but he cannot claim a record because more funding was provided under Obama. His $1.5 billion figure appears to include grants that have not yet been delivered.
